page.title: 10WILSON HOUSE
page.content: Wilson House,the first purpose-built home for the elderly in Northern Ireland,is situated at 17 Raceview Road and was opened in October, 1954.There are forty two residents, usually in the ratio of two ladies to one gentleman.They are all over the age of 65 years and the oldest at the moment is 95 years. Life for the residents of Wilson House is made to resemble home_life as much as possible.They have a spacious sitting room where they can chat,watch T.V.,read or just relax.Those who are able,can go for walks around the lovely gardens or into the village. There is a staff of 32 consisting of Head of Unity,Deputy Head of Unit,Third in Charge,Senior Care Assistants,Care Assistants,Cooks,Domestics,a launderer and a gardener.
